description: When a task's PR is merged, automatically clean up:

title: Investigate morning-review job not firing
description: The morning-review job has last_run: null and active_task_id: null on 2026-02-19, meaning it never executed. Check: 1) Was the orchestrator server running at 08:00 UTC? 2) Does cron_match.py correctly match '0 8 * * *'? 3) Is the job enabled and properly configured in jobs.yml? 4) Check jobs.log for any matching attempts.

title: Prevent retry loops on environment/tooling failures
description: When a task fails with 'command not found' or 'No such file or directory' for a build tool, the orchestrator should not retry automatically. These errors won't resolve without manual intervention. Implementation: 1) In run_task.sh post-processing, detect env failure patterns in agent output (command not found, No such file or directory for known tools) 2) Mark such tasks as needs_review instead of allowing auto-retry 3) Add the detected missing tool to the error message for clarity. On 2026-02-19, 14 tasks were bulk-retried at 02:21 UTC and all immediately failed with the same env issue, wasting tokens.

title: Review and implement retrospective improvement recommendations
orch project list: show managed bare-clone projects
description: Currently \`orch project list\` only shows GitHub Projects V2. It should also list managed bare-clone projects under \`~/.orchestrator/projects/\`.

title: @orchestrator mentions in GitHub comments to trigger tasks
description: Allow tagging @orchestrator in GitHub issue/PR comments to trigger actions. When mentioned, the orchestrator creates a task from the comment context and runs an agent to respond.

title: Owner feedback commands in GitHub issue comments
description: Extend the existing owner feedback system to support slash commands in GitHub issue comments.

title: Auto-reroute tasks to fallback agent on usage limit errors
description: When an agent (codex, claude, opencode) hits a usage/rate limit, the task currently fails to `needs_review` and requires manual intervention to reroute.

title: Add environment validation before agent execution
description: Before running a task, validate that required tools are available in the agent's PATH. If tools like bun, anchor, or solana-test-validator are missing, block the task immediately with a clear message instead of letting the agent waste tokens discovering the same issue. Implementation: 1) Add a required_tools field to .orchestrator.yml per project 2) In run_task.sh, check each tool with 'which' before launching the agent 3) If any tool is missing, set status=blocked with a descriptive reason. This addresses the #1 failure pattern from 2026-02-19 where 9+ tasks failed because of missing Codex sandbox tools.
